result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel A Meyers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Attorney Fees To Be Determined. 
Financial obligations are due within 60 days of the sentence date. The Barron County Clerk of Courts shall collect all financial obligations. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
10:37 AM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel A Meyers not in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Daniel A Meyers.
State moves to amend to ordinance violation of theft 9.12.  Court grants amendment.  No contest plea entered.  Court finds guilty and orders $267.50 forfeiture - 60 DTP.

Attempted to contact Defendant by phone 05/18 and 05/19 as the bond has not been signed yet.  Error message when dialing number in fiile: "the person you are trying to reach is not accepting calls at this time."  Judge advised Attorney in court 05/18 that bond still needs to be signed.

Defendant Daniel Meyers in Court.  Attorney Rockow appears in court for Defendant.  Brian Wright appears for State of Wisconsin.
 Warrant quashed.
Formal reading of Complaint waived.  Not guilty plea/s entered.  Hearing set for 07/06/2022 @ 10:00 a.m.  State does not object to reinstatement of bond. Court reinstates bond.  Address and phone number confirmed.  Bond continues.

10:23 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel A Meyers not in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Daniel A Meyers. 
Court relates Attorney Rockow has been appointed to this file, but Defendant does not appear.  Attorney Rockow relates on whereabouts of Defendant.  State requests Bench Warrant Body Only statewide.  Attorney Rockow requests warrant be stayed until the end of the day.  Court relates Defendant had notice and orders Bench Warrant Body Only Statewide.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on May 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 

Defendant must have no contact with K.F.S. dob 12/25/1948
Must sign bond by end of this week.

10:27 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel A Meyers appeared by video. 

Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney. 

Court enters NG plea on behalf of defendant.
Contact public defender today.
Hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
